item.title: Betsy add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Romain Rolland
item.description: "Be reverent before the dawning day. Do not think of what will be in a year, or in ten years. Think of to-day." -- Romain Rolland

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Jorge Amado
item.description: "The world is like that -- incomprehensible and full of surprises ." -- Jorge Amado
